page.title: 04Tourists
page.content: Lots of{tourists}vist Clovelly . They come from all over the world. Clovelly has a lovely street but it is very steep. It is awkward to take a push chair or pram down the street.There is a camping field and two hotels here, one half-way down and one at the bottom.{Provisions}are brought down on {sledges.}Clovelly is a very beautiful spot which attracts visitors.The top car park is mostly for the tourists.It costs 95p to get in. They can walk along The Quay and sit on it.There are a few gift shops. There are the {donkeys}for young children to ride on. Tourists come by cars,buses,coaches bikes,motorbikes and legs. There is a coastal footpath,Hobby Drive,The Court Garden and the church and chapels and sometimes flower festivals.Some people go on boat trips and fishing trips.
